posts.content:
Hello everybody!
As this build has been fully tested up to level 40, it's time to post it on the "Full Epic 40" section.

Recap:
After having played Orion’s Boccob tricky devastator (nice build, btw), roleplayed as an evil follower of Erythnul, I thought to make a “good-aligned” version.
However, one of the features of the Tricky Devastator is the presence of...devastating critical!
Initially a build with devastating critical has been made: it uses monk instead of rogue, to take advantage of the free cleave feat.
To increase challenge, I preferred to remove dev. crit., and so monk has been less useful: swift with rogue class, and extreme focus on Taunting ability, so to furtherly increase AB (think about adding a bard to the party....that would raise taunt to godly points!).

Main features:
  • wields a rapier (anyone can choose a different weapon) and she crits more than longsword-wielding creatures;
  • Extend spell feat doubles the castings of divine favor/aura of glory so CHA can be kept MAXed (reducing the need for specfic items), and craft wand to be able to make many wands (bless, bless weapon, holy sword, GMW, buls, eagle’s splendor, etc…);
  • Extreme focus on taunt skill, which can reach more than 60 points with capped CHA;
  • Mundane AB is 44;
  • Divine might/shield for additional aces up on her sleeve;
  • The only (??) build that takes "Epic Reputation" feat.

A few stats when buffed:
AB fully buffed: 44 + capped strenght 6 + divine favor 5 + greater magic weapon 5 + 3 (bless/aid/prayer) = 63
Add taunt, and have a further up to +6 --> 69

Damage fully buffed: STR 16 + 6 (weapon specializ + epic weap spec) + 3 (deafening clang) + 8 divine (divine might) + 5 GMW + 1 prayer + 5 divine favor = 43 (86 when critting).
Devastating critical DC (with capped STR): 46

AC:  base 30 + 20 (5 armor, 5 deflection, 5 dodge, 5 natural armor) = 50 + 5 shield + 8 divine shield + 5 expertise = 68
(one may want to take improved expertise feat to furtherly enchance AC)

Notes about the build:
Early on, as happens for each paladin, no spell slots are available: the main scope of these very low levels is to get through hordes of enemies by heavily using the "Taunt + expertise" combo (which is very effective).
This helps reducing enemy's AC and reducing the AB penalty from expertise; later, she can rely also on "Divine Favor" to temporarily offset the AB penalty.

Craft wand has been chosen due to WoG server customization (e.g. 50 charges per wand), so it can be replaced by many other feats.
Starting from level 12 and (subsequently) 15 she can use Divine Might/Shield so to increase the damage dealt or AC, and that can increase the likelihood of survivability (especially on one-to-one battles against bosses): thanks to "Eagle's splendor" and "Aura of Glory" spells she can almost cap CHA, hence she relies less on CHA-enchancing equipment than non-paladin CHA builds.

The main gains from the taunting ability are obtained late, as ESF:Taunt is obtained at level 36 and "Epic Reputation" at level 40: when level 40 has bene reached, taunt points are now 59 (65 with capped CHA) and she alone can taunt effectively also bosses.


Alternative suggested by Stagmeister: to swap rogue levels for Harper Scout.
Two feats have to be replaced by "Iron "Will" and Alterness" (Craft Wand and...?); however, this allows for an additional feat (like ESF:discpline) that can furtherly boost her skillset.

Comparison with other builds (old and new guild), that have more than 30 Paladin levels.

Holy Avenger: paladin 40 (human) by: GhostNWN

Pure paladin build, has many useful feats (e.g. divine shield/might), and has 43 AB.  Would have benefitted more from a maxed Taunt (add ESF: Taunt?) and concentration Skills rather than Heal (so she can safely cast Divine Favor when near to the enemies). Weak point is lack of multiclassing, but one cannot have it all.
(similar comment for the paladin yardstick builds in the new ecb guild).

An Unruly Knight: paladin 38 / rogue 1 / sorcerer 1 (human) by: Ithacan
Hidden Smiter, Crouching Avenger: monk 6 / shadowdancer 2 / paladin 32 (human?) by: Ithacan
Paladin 33 / WM 7: paladin 33 / weapon master 7 (human) by: o0ophrostbyteo0o
Focused on smiting, so more CHA rather than STR. Different concept.

Exhaulted Harper: paladin 35 / fighter 4 / Harper scout 1 (human) by: m_beaubien
STR build, has improved expertise and devastating critical. -1 AB and -2 STR, but +2 CHA. No defined skills (but taunt is one of the preferred ones).
